sect1.title: Statistics
sect1.para: Launching "Statistics" from the Network menu will result in the following window.

When selecting an attribute as a variable the statistics window will show results. If the given variable is a string then the histogram will remain empty. However the number of concepts (|C|) or relations (|R|) involved will be given. In the example below, 401 concepts have a GDS (Generalized Data Store) attribute of type "phenotype".

In the next example, CONF (confidence factor that the relations are indeed linking paralogs or orthologs) has been selected. As it is a number (rather than a string), it is possible for the tool to plot a histogram.
In the next figure, a concept class was also selected (Protein). This modified the graph as well as |R| which decreased from 1326 to 703 relations involved.
Furthermore, if a relation type is also selected ("para" for paralog in this case) the histogram is changed again and 61 relations are now concerned.
